- 1+ years of project management, including resource planning, managing schedules, reporting project status and prioritizing tasks experience

jobs.description:
When we hire you at Amazon, we hire for the future. You would be joining a team of environmental professionals focused on making a difference. With unlimited career opportunities, Amazon invests in ensuring our teams are always challenged, constantly learning from each other, and creatively contributing to our next big idea.

Key job responsibilities
• Assist with compliance of local, state, and federal environmental regulations and Amazon policy.
• Assist in driving an environmentally responsible culture within the organization.
• Conduct thorough and accurate environmental audits for continuous improvement.
• Prioritize and manage multiple assignments concurrently.
• Represent Amazon at appropriate levels with governmental agencies and throughout the company.
• Work collaboratively with contractors that maintain Amazon Environmental System.
• Support the completion of environmental incident investigations.
• Assist with managing and handling regulated waste programs.
• Assist with inspection and over site of Under Ground Fuel Storage and Hydrant Fuel Systems.
• Tracking of air emissions.
• Assist with storm water compliance, stream inspections and sampling.
• Assist with Ground Service Equipment (GSE) Maintenance Shop Inspections.
• Assist in inspection and oversite of Deicing Fluid Management Systems.
• Inspection during delivery of fuel and deicing fluid products.
• Inspect construction projects to assure sediment and erosion controls are maintained.
• Inspect oil/water separators, glycol storage tanks, and pump stations.
• Assist with spill clean-ups and emergency response.
• Travel up to 20% domestically

jobs.description:
We are seeking a leader to join Amazon's Global Road Safety team to drive implementation of Safety Management System (SMS) components across Amazon's transportation operations. In this role, you will shape transportation safety strategy, build sustainable safety management capabilities, and drive measurable improvements across Amazon's on-the-road transportation network, protecting the lives of people on road everywhere.

Key job responsibilities
This role focuses on engaging leaders at multiple levels and across organizations to accelerate safety risk decision-making and foster a proactive safety culture. You will establish and manage the governance structure that supports the SMS, including committees and working groups that enable effective decision-making. You will create, optimize, and drive adoption of mechanisms to ensure long-term SMS success. Additionally, you will translate SMS principles into language that resonates with diverse audiences and build coalitions to implement safety management best practices. Success in this role requires building trust and communicating effectively with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver sustainable, broad-scope results.

A day in the life
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: 1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage 2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options 3. Paid Time Off (PTO) 4. 401(k) Plan If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

jobs.description:
At Amazon, the Leadership Principle “Strive to be Earth’s Best Employer” challenges us to create “a safer, more productive, higher performing, more diverse, and more just work environment,” and reinforces that nothing is more important than the safety and well-being of our teams. At Workplace Health and Safety (WHS) we strive to do just this. We work tirelessly to ensure we have the appropriate strategy, technology, and attitude to be successful. We also understand that people are at the center of safety and look to invest in talent that shares in our passion for making our employees and partners lives better.

The WHS Data team is hiring a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE). The Data team spans the Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Engineering (DE) functional areas, and is responsible with providing all reporting solutions required by the WHS Organization to drive workplace safety and regulatory compliance worldwide. This BIE role will primarily support the data and reporting needs for the Safety Performance Insights (SPI) BI team in the WHS Organization. This role regularly requires close engagement with senior leaders and principal PMs to generate insights and deep dives into core metrics that directly impact organizational strategic decisions and priorities. The role requires high proficiency in complex SQL scripting, often joining together multiple types of data sets that range from normalized summaries to raw information spanning many diverse sources. The role will need to have a high bar for ownership and work autonomously to create high-quality products for the customer. The role is required to communicate project roadmap, prioritization, and release notes of new products with customer and stakeholder groups including leadership.

Key job responsibilities
-Contribute to the design, implementation, and delivery of BI solutions for complex and ambiguous problems
-Conduct deep dive analyses of business problem statements and formulate conclusions and recommendations to leadership
-Identify opportunities and key criteria to drive analytical reporting and business strategy
-Produce written recommendations and insights for key stakeholders that will help shape effective metric development and reporting
-Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities
-Partner with Data Engineering to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to customer insights
-Develop and drive best practices in data integrity, consistency, analysis, validations, and documentation
-Learn new technology and techniques to meaningfully support product and process innovation

A day in the life
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
1. Medical Coverage
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)

If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

jobs.description:
Are you interested in shaping the future of entertainment? Prime Video's technology, marketing, and operations teams are creating the best-in-class digital video experience. You’ll get to work on projects that are fast-paced, challenging, and varied. You’ll also be able to experiment with new possibilities, take risks, and collaborate with remarkable people.

Prime Video APAC and ANZ team is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer to drive customer insights for the PV APAC and ANZ analytics team. As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will generate insights that support Prime Video India's content, programming, marketing, and marketplace lines of business.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and large data sets. They will have strong attention to detail and an ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. They will have strong SQL skills, experience building visual dashboards, and the ability to clearly communicate information to business stakeholders.

Key job responsibilities
• Strong interest and ability to take complex datasets and boil them down to actionable data visualizations.
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing performance dashboards, metrics, reports, analyses, etc. to drive key business decisions.
• Build scalable, efficient, and automated data processes to inform business decision making.
• Proactively develop new metrics and studies to quantify customer behavior and reduce customer churn.

jobs.description:
The Facilities Coordinator will have a significant impact on customer experience. The Facilities Coordinator will have the ability to lead and manage outside contractors, be on call for emergencies, to handle multiple projects and daily activities, and meet time lines. The Facilities Coordinator will develop plans on how to accomplish engineering departmental goals.

The Facilities Coordinator will be responsible for the leadership/development and coaching of the team. Performance Management will be carried out by the Facilities Coordinator – Maintenance. This role also leads the technical team in providing both a reactive and pro-active maintenance service on all operational equipment and facilities infrastructure within the Fulfilment Centre (FC). The role has a direct impact on the site, its productivity and operational success. If equipment is not available or performs badly it minimizes the capacity and throughput of the site.




Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities will include:
To provide supervision and leadership to Facility Supervisors
To develop Preventive and predictive maintenance of FC assets including material handling and automation systems
To be experienced in installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting any of the following: relay logic, ladder diagrams, controls components, sensors & scanners, motor starters, relays, limit switches, electronic sensors, servo drives, frequency inverters, linear drives, sorters, mechanical components (rolls, bearing, belts)
To act as an ambassador for safety within the team and to promote safe working across the site
Manage day to day engineering and soft services including housekeeping and upkeep of premises
To Manage EHS and statuary compliances of FC including waste management and hazardous waste management as per bylaws, timely renewal of licenses
To develop and maintain a good working relationship across all levels in the organization
Ability to provide enriched feedback to enhance individual performance
Ability to prioritize and manage resources under high pressure
Oversees day-to-day facility operations, including conveyor system maintenance, supervises maintenance work and sub-contractors, Ensure implementation of facility systems checks through computerized maintenance management system. Provide technical guidance for MHE and BB maintenance.

jobs.description:
Would you like to be part of a team focused on driving innovation in the transportation industry while working to empower entrepreneurs and contribute to Amazon’s sustainability goals?

Equal parts advisor and operating partner, Amazon’s team of Delivery Partner Managers assists and guides our Amazon DSPs (Delivery Service Partner) business owners as they build and grow successful middle-mile businesses during a transformational time.

Delivery Partner Manager manage the DSP relationship across the entire lifecycle of the business. As trusted advisors, Delivery Partner Manager, work alongside DSPs to help solve their biggest challenges at a programmatic level, influence their business planning and strategy, and look around corners to identify obstacles and recommend solutions, ensuring DSP owners make effective business decisions and are set up for success.

Key job responsibilities
- As a Delivery Partner Manager, you will partner with 25-30 DSP owners across the Emirates (UAE) including entrepreneurs with no background in the logistics industry, or seasoned logistics carrier (Depending on business program)
- Work closely with a portfolio of owners at different stages as they set strategy, help drive accountability and engagement, and motivate and track key performance metrics.
- Collaborate with an integrated internal team of Program Managers and Compliance and Finance personnel to ensure owners launch and scale their business in compliance with program requirements.
- Support owners by removing obstacles and improving financial, operational, and safety practices at the network level.
- As Lead, Delivery Partner Manager will do this by analyzing problems, discovering insights, delivering recommendations, and driving change both internally and externally.
- They will collaborate frequently with a wide array of integrated internal stakeholders such as Partner Relations (PAR), Value Added Service (VAS), Legal, fleet and network health to name a few. The Delivery Partner Managers support owners by removing obstacles and improving financial, operational, and safety practices at the network level. They facilitate and execute Monitoring and Enforcement Policies (MEP) and build two-way feedback channels with OTR teams, DSPs and WW/EU Product and strategy.
- The Delivery Partner Manager will be required to work flexibly and will be required to travel between multiple sites to engage with business owners weekly to carry out their role effectively.

A day in the life
The role is field based and requires a significant level of travel as well as requiring flexibility to work a variety of hours as business demands, including overnight, weekends and holidays.

Key job responsibilities
- Safety: Partnering with OTR Safety and OTR Regional Managers to ensure business safety compliance.
- Performance: Guiding owners as they scale their business and manage operational issues, ensuring they have resources in place to effectively ramp-up operations and prepare for peak period.
- Performance: Supporting owners as they onboard to the program and prepare to launch (this will be on the basis of a net new launch only)
- Performance: Coach and ensure effective upskilling and utilisation of AMZL tools.
- Performance: Deep dive to identify customer metric improvement opportunities.
- Performance: Champion the consistent application of Last Mile processes within Delivery Stations – challenge UTR processes that impact OTR.
- Performance: Coaching business owners to run compliant, safe and high performing companies (SLS metric deep dive)
- Experience: Identifying workflow inefficiencies and working to formulate and implement operational improvements at the network level and to improve the individual DSP owner experience.
- Experience: Developing the relationship between Amazon and our DSP partners (DSP sentiment improvements)
- Experience: Communication alignment to DSP business owners following close collaboration with OTR partners.
- Be the voice of the DSP within and represent them within the AMZL business.
- Experience: Improve driver standards to protect brand image.
- Capacity Management: Work with the DSP’s to deliver effective ramp plans and pipeline goals ensuring driver supply is achieved to meet peak volume demands.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- Experience using analytical, account management, and productivity tools, such as, Oracle Business Intelligence, SalesForce, Tableau, or similar
- Experience in program management, logistics, operations, supply chain, transportation, or a related field
jobs.description:
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we're constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfill and deliver orders. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our customers. To meet this goal, Amazon is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels through the introduction of pioneering new products and services in the last mile delivery space.

The AMET (Africa, Middle East and Turkey) Fleet organization is responsible for managing and growing Amazon's Last Mile Fleet across the region. We are seeking an exceptional Senior Manager to lead Fleet Strategy, Planning and Programs for the AMET (Africa, Middle East, and Turkey) region—one of our fastest-growing and most dynamic markets.

In this pivotal role, you will be the strategic architect of AMET's fleet operations, responsible for the complete fleet lifecycle from demand forecasting and procurement to operational excellence and partner experience. You'll leverage sophisticated analytical modeling to predict fleet requirements years in advance, drive operational excellence through data-driven insights, and ensure our Delivery Service Partners (DSPs) have the tools and support they need to succeed.
This is a rare opportunity to shape the future of Amazon's logistics capabilities in a high-growth region. You'll work at the intersection of strategy, operations, analytics, and partnership management—driving decisions that impact hundreds of millions of dollars in capital investments while building the foundation for sustainable growth.

The ideal candidate combines deep analytical capabilities with strong business acumen and exceptional stakeholder management skills. You'll need to be equally comfortable building sophisticated forecasting models, coaching operations teams on best practices, and presenting strategic recommendations to senior leadership. You'll thrive in ambiguity, design scalable solutions for emerging markets, and have a commitment to operational excellence and customer obsession.
This role requires approximately 30% travel across the AMET region to build relationships, conduct operational assessments, and drive change management initiatives.


Key job responsibilities
1. Fleet Demand Planning & Forecasting
- Design and develop scalable fleet demand modeling to predict last mile van / size requirements across Africa, Middle East, and Turkey

- Create demand plans for multiple vehicle specifications (diesel/electric, long/short wheel base, specialized configurations) across long-term strategic (+3 years), medium-term tactical (12-18 months), and short-term operational (<12 months) planning horizons

- Consolidate input from diverse stakeholders to ensure fleet plans always consume the latest available assumptions and business strategies

2. Strategic Partnerships & Vendor Management
- Develop and execute strategic partnerships across the AMET transportation ecosystem, focusing on long-term value creation with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), rental/leasing providers, upfitting vendors, maintenance service providers, and parts suppliers (in partnership with Global Fleet Procurement GFP organization)

- Identify and capitalize on commercial opportunities through market analysis, competitive benchmarking, cost optimization initiatives, multi-country fleet sharing, and alternative supply channels (e.g., used vehicle markets)

3. Network Capacity & Supply Chain Optimization
- Lead strategic initiatives to optimize network capacity across AMET, balancing fleet supply and demand across stations, coordinating short-term deployment scheduling, and optimizing for seasonal demand variations

- Collaborate extensively with Finance business partners to ensure plans are efficient and meet peak demand requirements, drive efficient capital allocation (CAPEX), optimize operating expenses (OPEX), and develop Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) models

- Develop innovative program management mechanisms to drive data-driven decision-making across make vs. buy vs. rent trade-offs, vehicle type mix optimization, asset utilization improvements, and investment prioritization

- Monitor and optimize key metrics to ensure smooth supply chain operations, addressing procurement lead times, parts availability, and cross-border logistics complexities unique to AMET markets

4. DSP Partner Experience & Voice of Customer
- Establish and expand listening mechanisms to capture Delivery Service Partner feedback including regular surveys, sentiment analysis, focus groups, partner councils, operational data analysis, and direct engagement during station visits

- Analyze, report, and take action on customer feedback data to identify and drive opportunities to improve the level of service GFP offers to DSP partners, combining qualitative sentiment data with quantitative service benchmarking

- Identify and prioritize DSP pain points related to fleet operations including vehicle reliability, maintenance processes, administrative burden, cost transparency, and training gaps

- Develop and launch innovative programs and value-added services to improve DSP experience and productivity (e.g., preventive maintenance programs, roadside assistance, simplified processes, self-service tools, training materials)

- Measure DSP satisfaction through Net Promoter Score (NPS), program adoption rates, and qualitative feedback themes, with target improvements of +5 NPS points annually

- Collaborate with DSP Program teams across organizations to ensure fleet decisions consider partner impact, co-develop solutions to shared challenges, and maintain strong exchange of insights on partner needs

5. Executive Leadership & Cross-Functional Influence
- Own executive-level business reviews and strategic planning sessions, delivering data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to VP and senior leadership stakeholders

- Write and contribute to compelling business cases using information synthesized from multiple stakeholders, propose and obtain approval from functional leaders, and maintain project schedules that enable teams to succeed

- Take accountability while providing transparent status updates, proactively asking for help and immediately escalating issues and problems as necessary to remove blockers

6. Innovation & Strategic Initiatives
- Drive the transition to electrification by integrating Electric Vehicle (EV) planning into business-as-usual fleet requirement processes, considering charging infrastructure, range requirements, and total cost of ownership

- Extend Fleet Requirement Planning processes to new business customer organizations (e.g., Sub-same Day, DSP Lite) and new countries as AMET expands, building replicable playbooks for rapid market entry

- Lead full life-cycle of complex cross-functional projects and programs with considerable impact across multiple organizations, working to understand business problems, automation limitations, scaling factors, and reasons behind leadership decisions

- Design solutions that can adapt to each AMET market's unique maturity level, account for varying data availability and quality, work within local constraints, and maintain global standards while allowing regional flexibility



A day in the life
Your day will be dynamic, strategic, and highly impactful. You might start by reviewing overnight fleet utilization data across AMET markets, identifying a pattern of underutilization in one country and overdemand in another—prompting you to coordinate a cross-border vehicle transfer. You'll join a strategic planning session with Finance to present your updated 18-month fleet forecast, defending your assumptions and securing approval for a significant vehicle procurement order.
Mid-morning, you'll dive into your forecasting model, adjusting parameters based on new network expansion plans shared by the Operations team, then run scenario analyses to understand the impact on CAPEX requirements.
After lunch, you might review DSP feedback survey results, identifying a recurring theme about maintenance delays. You'll brainstorm solutions with the maintenance vendor and draft a proposal for a new preventive maintenance program. You'll then prepare for your afternoon executive business review, creating visualizations that tell a compelling story about fleet performance trends and your strategic recommendations.
Late afternoon brings a call with regional fleet managers across Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Turkey—you're coaching them on a new audit framework and gathering their input on local market dynamics that should inform your demand forecast. You wrap up your day by analyzing repair cost trends, identifying an opportunity to consolidate vendors and save on OPEX.
Throughout, you're the critical link ensuring our fleet remains reliable, safe, cost-efficient, and perfectly sized to meet customer demand—balancing analytical rigor with operational pragmatism and strategic thinking.

jobs.description:
Amazon is looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the Product Strategy for RBS Intelligence Platform. As Sr. Product Manager, you will own the business strategy, tenant acquisition, and adoption roadmap. You'll drive the platform growth from 3 prototypes to 70+ production systems, delivering hundreds of millions in business value. This role requires exceptional stakeholder management, business acumen, and the ability to translate technical capabilities into compelling business outcomes. The Sr. Product Manager is a bar-raising communicator, both verbal and written, and is a well-respected leader within the business. This role requires the ability to influence across stakeholder teams to drive alignment and requires a highly effective and established leader to navigate effectively. This role requires clear articulation of complex problems and proposed solutions and requires high judgement to ensure the right leaders are involved in decisions and regularly informed on progress. This role aligns teams towards clear priorities and advocates for investment delivering large, complex business initiatives, with clear mechanisms that audit progress towards shared goals and regularly reports results to ensure long-term business success.

Key requirements for this role:
- 5+ years of product management experience
- 5+ years of business strategy and adoption experience
- Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy, definition and end to end product delivery
- Track record of driving significant business impact
- Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, or related field

Key job responsibilities
1. Business Strategy & Vision - Own the business strategy, value proposition, and go-to-market planning; define tenant evaluation frameworks and prioritization criteria; develop business case templates and ROI models for tenant adoption.
2. Tenant Acquisition & Relationship Management - Build and manage a pipeline of 70+ potential tenant systems; lead tenant discovery, evaluation, and onboarding processes; establish executive relationships with VP/Director-level stakeholders.
3. Customer Journey & Experience - Design the end-to-end tenant journey from discovery to production; define user personas and their needs; create adoption playbooks and change management strategies to drive tenant satisfaction.
4. Business Impact & Metrics - Define success metrics for tenant value delivery; track and report business impact including cost savings, customer experience improvements, and efficiency gains; conduct quarterly business reviews with stakeholders.
5. Domain Product Management - Define domain-specific strategies across areas like returns, inventory, and advertising; drive cross-domain learning and best practice sharing; scale the product management function as the platform grows.

About the team
The Growth team within RBS is transforming how Amazon makes operational decisions. We're building a platform that drives context-aware capabilities through advanced pattern detection and ML/LLM approaches. Our multi-disciplinary team combines analytics, science, and engineering expertise to solve complex challenges in real-time decision processing and pattern sharing across diverse tenants. Working closely with multiple business domains across Amazon SDO and AWS organizations, we're driving Amazon's next phase of efficiency gains through intelligent automation. As part of RBS's Growth organization, we operate at the intersection of technical innovation and business impact.
jobs.description_short: Amazon is looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the Product Strategy for RBS Intelligence Platform. As Sr. Product Manager, you will own the business strategy, tenant acquisition, and adoption roadmap.
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders
- Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools
- Experience influencing senior leaders/stakeholders
- Experience with change management and organizational transformation
- MBA from top-tier institution
- Fluency with AI/ML product development

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. jobs.company_name: Servicios Comerciales Amazon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.
jobs.description:
Salario mensual base:$18,000.00 MXN brutos más prestaciones superiores a las de ley.
Ubicación: Priv. Arturo Macías 504, San Cristóbal, 67190 Guadalupe, N.L., Mexico

Amazon tiene implementadas las medidas necesarias para garantizar que los trabajadores cuenten con asientos adecuados. Durante los periodos de descanso y comida, los empleados podrán tomar su descanso en el área de comedor donde se encuentran las sillas disponibles, o salir de las instalaciones de la Empresa si así lo desean.

En Amazon, estamos trabajando para ser la principal compañía enfocada en los clientes.
Estamos buscando un líder de afiliación de nuevos negocios para nuestra organización en el área de última milla para la entrega de paquetes (Amazon Logistics).

En esta posición serás el responsable de supervisar la expansión del programa mediante nuevas afiliaciones de negocios en un área asignada.
Los negocios que se afilien en tu área proporcionarán el servicio de entrega de paquetes a los clientes que compran en la tienda en línea de Amazon.

Key job responsibilities
- Trabajar en campo para identificar y afiliar nuevos negocios en tu territorio asignado.
- Tener el control y seguimiento de 45 a 50 partners.
- Identificar oportunidades y áreas de mejora con los clientes dentro del proceso de entrega.
- Visitar a los negocios afiliados de manera periódica para mantener la comunicación y compromiso.
- Realizar mapas de calor para visualizar las zonas dentro de tu territorio donde se requiere la afiliación de nuevos negocios.
- Aclarar expectativas, proveer comunicación clara y mantener una relación efectiva con los negocios afiliados dentro de tu territorio.
- Trabajar con los afiliados dentro de tu territorio para mejorar aspectos operacionales de impacto a la experiencia de los clientes.
- Mejorar el compromiso con los afiliados para incrementar su permanencia.
- Asegurar el volumen de colocación de las tiendas, así como, contribuir con sus capacitaciones para la entrega de paquetes.

#AmazonMexico
